item.description:

item.title: Orsett Terrace southside, outside No. 19., 2nd September
item.description:

item.title: Fridge dumped on street, 2nd September
item.description:
A fridge has been dumped on the pathway for over a month and has still not been removed. Please arrange for its collection as soon as possible, as it is obstructing the path and unsightly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sladedale Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Blocked drain and litter/leaves, 2nd September
item.description:
Following the removal of the containers between 49 Norman Road and 1 Tarves Way, there is an awful lot of leaves and litter which need removing. There is also a blocked drain gully adjacent to the entrance next to 1 Tarves Way. The drain is full of leaves and litter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Tarves Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: High hedge not respected, 2nd September
item.description:
I reported that the conifer trees along the perimeter of Ravensbourne school and Cromwell Close had grown to about 30ft about 3 years ago, and they had formed a solid barrier outside my house in breach of the high hedge act. I reported this to the council, the agent I discussed this with agreed and he said he would get it reduced to six feet which is what happened. And I was told the school would have to keep the hedge to six feet. However some of the trees have not been trimmed and are now growing to about 12 feet. I pointed this out to the contractor which visits only once a year today and he took no notice. So the trees have not been cut. I was expecting that all the conifer trees would be kept to six feet.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs pruning outside 39/41 Clarence Road, BR12DD, 2nd September
item.description:
The tree outside the property needs pruning as the branches are almost touching the houses. The falling leaves cause our guttering to become blocked, potentially causing damage to our property. The tree is also blocking our light and allowing pigeons to poo all over my wall and front garden. The pavement outside the house is also covered in bird poo which people regularly tread in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shrubs on walk way Brooks Way by Main Rd, 2nd September
item.description:
The shrubs by Main Rd going into Brooks Way need trimming back and trimmed on top they haven’t been cut back in ages and are far to high now so need cutting back / trimmed on top as well before the nights start to draw in . Women walk through there to the bus stop

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Way, St Paul's Cray, London
